knowledge: History of Newcastle, New South Wales . The Port of Newcastle remains the economic and trade centre for the resource rich Hunter Valley and for much of the north and northwest of New South Wales. Newcastle is the world's largest coal export port and Australia's oldest and second largest tonnage throughput port, with over 3,000 shipping movements handling cargo of per annum, of which coal exports represented in 2007/08. The volume of coal exported, and attempts to increase coal exports, are opposed by environmental groups.
